Recap: Miles has his day in court with Natalie by his side. The judge declares that there is not enough evidence to take Miles' case to court and drops all the charges against him. Miles pleads guilty when it comes to what he did to Marty. Marcie has breakfast with Lindsay at the diner and lets her know that John not only thinks Michael killed Spencer, but now John thinks that Marcie may have killed Spencer. An unknown man is shown into a hotel room. Bo assigns Antonio and Talia to work together on some new cases. Talia is rattled when she finds that she will be working so closely with Antonio. Nash comes into the room and finds Jessica packing. He asks her if she is leaving him and she replies that she is. Max sees Blair outside the courtroom when Todd walks up. John visits Marty in her cell. He lets Marty know that he figured out who killed Spencer and it wasn't she.
Transcript: Nash: Whoo! It's not much.
Man: So, this is it. It's not much.
Banks: Well, if you consider where I was living before, this is actually a step up.
Man: Where were you -- prison? Never mind -- I don't want to know. I just need my money at the end of each week.
Banks: Oh, you'll have it. I intend to be rolling in it real soon.
Man: Asa Buchanan?
Banks: Yeah.
Man: I still can't believe he's gone.
Banks: What do you mean, "gone"?
Man: He died two days ago. It's been all over the news -- you haven't heard?
Banks: No. No, I didn't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: All right, I'll call you back. What? Yes, come in. Nora, hi. Sorry. I don't mean to bark at you.
Nora: You're entitled.
Bo: Well, we got a full plate today, starting with Miles Laurence -- his preliminary hearing and everything. Do you -- do you need to go over things with me or something?
Nora: I'm not talking about work, Bo.
Bo: Ok. What?
Nora: You. Your father just died. Why don't you take some time?
Bo: Because I got too much to do.
Nora: You think burying yourself under work is going to make everything better?
Bo: No. No, you're right. I just can't believe he's gone.
Officer: Hey, Detective, you back for good?
Antonio: That's the plan.
Officer: That's great, I'm glad to hear it.

Natalie: Mom, what -- Miles.
Miles: Hi.
Natalie: Hi.

Natalie: Oh -- yeah -- it smells great.
Miles: Oh. Good, I hope so -- I'm new at this.
Natalie: Hmm.
Miles: I figured if I follow the directions in the cookbook, what could go wrong, right?
Natalie: Sure.
[Natalie chuckles]
Miles: Ooh, it's a little burned.
Natalie: Ok, I like my food well-done.
Miles: Oh, good. Oh, my preliminary hearing's this morning. I'll have to be leaving soon.
Natalie: Not alone, you're not.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Max: Blair?
Blair: Max. What are you doing here? I thought you'd be halfway to Argentina by now.
Max: My -- my plane doesn't leave for a while.
Blair: So you thought you'd stop by the courthouse for old times' sake?
Max: Yeah, well, we -- we clocked a few hours in here, you and me.
Blair: Good times?
Max: I miss them -- good and bad. Uh -- look. I knew you'd be here and I didn't want to leave without seeing you one more time.
Blair: You know, Max, I thought we went through all this yesterday at Asa's funeral.
Max: Yeah, we did, we did. I know, and don't worry -- I'm not going to kiss you again.
Todd: You kissed him?
Blair: Uh --
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marcie: Hide the knives!
Michael: What?
Marcie: Well, your brother thinks I'm a psycho stabber!
Michael: Come on, don't even joke about that.

Marcie: What? Come on! I'm sorry, but even in his worst nightmares, for your brother to think that I killed Spencer Truman -- don't get me wrong. I didn't love the guy, but murder him? What possible motive would I even have?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marty: John.
John: Didn't wake you, did I?
Marty: No, I -- ooh. I just had trouble sleeping last night, so I -- oh, I must've dozed off.
John: What's wrong?
Marty: No, I just had a -- a bad dream. I don't remember it, though. What are you doing here?
John: I just wanted to stop by and -- and make sure you were all right.
Marty: You know, you can tell me, whatever it is.
John: Off the record?
Marty: Of course.
John: I think I figured out who killed Truman, and it wasn't you.
Marty: You have proof it was somebody else, hard evidence?
John: Can't say much at this point. I just want to let you know I'm still on the case and I haven't given up. Neither should you.
Marty: No, I just -- I wish I could remember what happened, why -- why the scissors were in my hand, what did I do once I raised them?
John: You may not have to.
Marty: Well, what if you're wrong?
John: I'm not.
Marty: Look, I had motive. He threatened Cole. Any mother would do the same to protect her son.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Michael: Listen, John does not think that we killed Spencer.
Marcie: Well, then why did he even bring it up?
Michael: Hmm? He's being thorough, you know? The guy's got to look under every rock.
Marcie: Why didn't he look at Marty Saybrooke? She confessed.
Michael: He doesn't believe she did it.
Marcie: That's because he has a thing for her.
Michael: No. He doesn't let stuff like that get in his way --
Marcie: Oh.
Michael: Unfortunately.
Marcie: Uh-uh. She had means, she had motive. And, ok, you know, maybe I did tell him that I would kill anyone who hurt my son, but, you know, come on! What is he thinking? He knows I know better.
Lindsay: Hey, guys.
Michael: Hey.
Marcie: Hey.
Lindsay: Hi, doughnut. Oops -- I'm sorry to interrupt.
Marcie: Uh-uh.
Lindsay: I got your call.
Marcie: Yes. Thank you for coming.
Michael: Ok, well, I should let you ladies get to it.
Marcie: No. Why don't you stay? You know, this isn't private.
Michael: Um -- I got stuff to take care of. I'll see you later.
Marcie: Mm-hmm.
Lindsay: Huh.
[Marcie sighs]
Lindsay: What's wrong?
Marcie: Oh, my husband's driving me crazy, but I digress. I have good news.
Lindsay: Wow. And who couldn't use that?
Marcie: You are going to love this. Do you know who I'm looking at?
Lindsay: Um -- me, I think.
Marcie: Well, not just you, but Llanview's 2007 Woman of the Year.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blair: The kiss didn't mean anything, Todd.
Todd: That doesn't say much for you, lover boy.
Blair: Max and I are just friends, ok?
Todd: What, do you get turned on by funerals?
Blair: Todd --
Max: No, it's ok, Blair. Don't go get in the mud with him.
Todd: Well, I'll bet you'd like that -- to see Blair in a -- in a mud- wrestling competition.
Max: Ok, that's it.
Blair: No, you know what?
Max: But, no, no -- he can take pot shots at me all he wants, but once he starts on you --
Todd: You've got the hots for her, man. Why don't you just admit it and get over it? You lost.
Blair: Stop it! We're here to fight Miles Laurence today, not Max, all right?
Todd: It seems like he started it. So, what do you want anyway? A little -- a little quickie? You know, blow the dust off the --
Blair: Uh -- for your information, Max is on his way back to Argentina.
Todd: Oh. And he was going to give you a "companion flies free" ticket?
Max: Well, since you brought it up, yes. I asked Blair to come back with me.
Todd: He did?
Blair: Yeah.
Todd: So isn't that winter down there or something? It's -- it's not conducive to vacation.
Max: Oh, no, actually, it's great in the winter. I'm sure that Jack and Starr are just going to love it, and I told Blair that if she and the kids like it, they could stay.
Todd: Oh --
Blair: Don't even think about it, Todd.
Max: No, why don't I just give you two a moment.
Blair: You know, when are you ever going to get over this?
Todd: When that son of a bitch stops jerking you around.
Blair: Maybe he wasn't doing that.
Todd: So you're -- you're really considering this?
Blair: Well, actually, I did.
Todd: Oh.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Miles: Don't you have enough to deal with? Your grandfather died, you have a new job. You don't need to be holding my hand at my hearing.
Natalie: Did it ever occur to you that maybe I need a distraction?
Miles: Today's no big deal. The judge is going to decide whether my case goes to trial. It's a foregone conclusion.
Natalie: And you would do it for me.
Miles: Well, yeah -- definitely. But what makes you so sure I'm not guilty?
Natalie: You have a good heart, Miles.
Miles: Hmm. You're an incredible friend. I have to get ready for court.
Natalie: Ok.

Natalie: Michael?
Michael: Hey.
Natalie: Uh -- who you looking for?
Michael: You.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Bo: Is Matthew doing any better today?
Nora: Yeah, a little bit, you know? Nigel's been helping him to feel better. Wow -- he loved his grandfather like crazy.
Bo: They both did.
Nora: Yeah.
Bo: I think those two were probably Pa's best friends.
Nora: Well, look, don't cut yourself off that list.
Bo: No. No, we weren't friends. He was my father.
Nora: Can't be both?
Bo: Sure you can. I try with Matthew, I try to be his friend and his father because I don't want to make the same mistakes Pa made. But, you know, now, I -- I don't know. I have so many questions.

Nora: Well, that happens, you know, when -- when somebody dies. You start looking at life very differently. This is none of my business, but if you need the time, take it. Don't force things. I'll let you know what's going on in court.
Bo: Hey.
Nora: Yeah?
Bo: Thanks a lot, Nora.
Nora: Yeah.

Antonio: Yeah, well, I was there to support Bo.

Antonio: Well, I'm not going to pretend it doesn't suck having them in my face all the time.

Jessica: I just need to get away.

Jessica: Oh, well, you -- you'd want to come with us.
Nash: Yeah.

Nash: The other end? Where -- where is that, exactly?
Jessica: Well, I want to go and see Kelly and my brothers, and, you know, Bree is Zane's cousin, or his aunt or something, and --
Nash: London. You're talking about London.
Jessica: Yes -- I know it sounds impulsive.
Nash: "Impulsive"? Yeah.
Jessica: Well, I talked to Kelly for a long time on the phone last night, and you know, Michael cleared me to go.
Nash: Jessica, what is all this about? I mean -- except for our night at Niagara Falls in your hospital room, we haven't even had a honeymoon yet.
Jessica: This has nothing to do with you. I promise.
Nash: Oh, ok, yeah, sure. I -- I know you'd never lie to me. I just don't understand.
Jessica: I just -- I need a little space. Can you give me that?

[Marcie chuckles]
Lindsay: I can't believe it.
Marcie: Believe it. Look at all the amazing things you've done this year, Lindsay, especially that advocacy group for moms and children? Believe me, it wasn't a tough sell, ok?
Lindsay: I -- I just don't know what to say.
Marcie: You deserve this. You've helped so many people. It's a testament to the kind of woman that you are. Jen would've been really proud of her mom right now.
Lindsay: I'm not really so sure about that.

John: Jury selection starts today -- did your lawyer talk to you about that?
Marty: Yeah, yeah. She said she was going to try to get a lot of women on the jury, said they might be more sympathetic towards my motive.
John: Well, you pled not guilty. There really isn't a motive.
Marty: Why are you so sure I'm innocent?
John: Well, for starters, your memories don't include the actual stabbing.
Marty: There's a lot of reasons for that.
John: Really? All right. Well, how about you explain how you woke up in the on-call room, passed out with a head injury we can't explain? And I just know.
Marty: Yeah, well, that's not going to quite cut it in court.
John: Yeah, but reasonable doubt will, and there's a lot of that.
Marty: It doesn't mean a jury is going to see it that way.
John: Look, you love your son. I think anyone can see that. A murder conviction takes you away from him. I think that alone means there's no way you could've killed Truman.
Marty: Not necessarily.
John: What are you, opposing counsel today?
Marty: Look, I'm playing devil's advocate.
John: Yeah, ok, I'll play. So let's say you killed Truman because you're trying to defend Blair. Would you really have stabbed him nine times and then run away?
Marty: Look, I must have.
John: You don't know that for sure.
Marty: You know what -- and neither do you. The D.A. considers this case closed, so if you are using department time to try to find another suspect, you could get in a lot of trouble.
John: If the truth comes out, I don't care.
Marty: Yeah, well, I do.
John: All right. Well, then maybe you can understand where I'm coming from here, all right? You're already in a lot of trouble, and I'm going to get you out of it, no matter what I have to do.

(Music plays throughout )
Nash: Yeah, you can have anything you want -- even space. Just -- tell me why you need it.

Nash: You sure?

Nash: Then who Antonio?

Nash: Oh.

Nash: Yeah. You know, losing Asa -- I'm just not sure the traveling, that's really going to help you with that.
Jessica: A little time and distance might help with things a little.
Nash: How about work?
Jessica: Todd said I could write from London.
Nash: Hmm. So that's it? You're sure?
Jessica: Honey, nobody knows me there, you know? I can go shopping and I can take the kids to the museum and not worry about somebody around the corner whispering about me, about what I've done.

Antonio: Well, I -- I'm not sure the timing for this is -- is right.
Bo: The answer's yes.
Antonio: You didn't even know what I was going to ask you.
Bo: Well, you want to get back to work, don't you?

Bo: I'll be honest with you -- I need your help. So, welcome back, Detective.

Lindsay: Well, losing a child -- you can't help but change. But you do things that you never thought were even possible.

Marcie: I know. That's why I nominated you for Woman of the Year, because that's what you are to me. You know, I never knew my mom, except in pictures. Blair: Ok.

Todd: You mean you and him or you and me?

Todd: Is it -- I don't 
